properties.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 11 at 2:22AM CST until January 11 at 5:15AM CST by NWS Memphis TN
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a

* Flash Flood Warning for...
Central Craighead County in eastern Arkansas...

* Until 515 AM CST.

* At 219 AM CST...Doppler Radar estimates 1 to 3 inches of rain has
occurred across central Craighead County over the past 90 minutes.
Some roads are impassable in the Jonesboro area, including South
Caraway Road. An additional 1-2 inches of rain is possible due to
the training of these thunderstorms.

HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas,
highways, streets and underpasses as well as other
drainage and low lying areas.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Jonesboro, Bono, Bay, Brookland, Hergett, Apt, Herman, Valley View,
Farrville, Gilkerson, Otwell, Cary, Herndon, Goobertown, Needham
and Craighead Forest Park.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the
dangers of flooding.

Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of small
creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as
well as other drainage areas and low lying spots.

CMAMtext: NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 5:15 AM CST. Avoid flooded areas.
